replies.bodyText:
oh 😊 My bad, editing on another computer now.
OT: Could Armeria add a .editorconfig (which seems to be the de-facto standard) with the correct indentation settings? Lowers the bar of (correct) contributions quite a bit.
-- Edit:
Was editing in Vim... no .editorconfig support by default in that anyway.

timeline.author: minwoox
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -195,6 +195,15 @@ one of the following supported types:
     - `LocalDate`, `LocalDateTime` and `LocalTime`,
     - `OffsetDateTime` and `OffsetTime`
     - `ZonedDateTime`, `ZoneId` and `ZoneOffset`
+- Custom types with either of the following public static methods taking a single `String` parameter. Note that
+  these are scanned for in the order below the first matching method being used,
+  and if that method throws an exception, no other methods will be tried and that exception will
+  be propagated.
+  - `public static T of(String)`
+  - `public static T valueOf(String)`
+  - `public static T fromString(String)`
+  - `public T(String)` (constructor)
+
